description: Situational adjustment rules for NHL 25 â€” tells Architect/Dynasty when to change forecheck, pressure, breakouts, NZ trap, and offensive strategy during a game based on score, momentum, fatigue, and opponent tendencies.

down_by_2_plus.rationale: Increase forecheck pressure, activate D, open middle of ice.

down_by_1.rationale: Controlled push without exposing rush chances.

tied.rationale: Neutral setup until momentum or matchup advantage appears.

up_by_1.rationale: Trap middle ice and restrict high-danger rushes.

up_by_2_plus.rationale: Force dumps, clog neutral zone, protect slot.

opponent_momentum_spike.rationale: Slow game down and break cycle momentum.

your_team_hot.rationale: Capitalize on momentum with high press and speed.

defense_tired.rationale: Reduce gap strain and support low-energy defenders.

forwards_tired.rationale: Shorten shifts and avoid long cycle battles.

heavy_cycle_team.rationale: Break their low-high rhythm and kill cycle pressure.

rush_attack_team.rationale: Eliminate middle ice lanes and force dump-ins.

point_shot_team.rationale: Pressure their shooters and cut off blue-line options.
